explanation: The report is correct. In OS_Console_CopyOut the local variable return_code is set to OS_ERROR immediately before entering a while(true) loop. Every possible exit from that loop assigns return_code (either OS_SUCCESS when the terminator is found, or OS_QUEUE_FULL when the buffer is full) before the loop is broken and the function returns. There is no path that uses the initial OS_ERROR value, so the assignment is executed but has no effect on program behaviour. That meets the definition of dead code in MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2. (The only caveat — a malformed input pointer leading to undefined behavior — does not create a path that uses the initial value; it is UB.)
